oracleproject

Class FileStatistic

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracleproject.FileStatistic

  • public class FileStatistic
extends java.lang.Object
    FileStatistics is a library of methods that return data of a .txt file. The constructor takes in a filePath from the current working directory as a parameter. A buffered reader is used to store and read a line of the file at a time. lineCount and wordCount are private class members as they are used multiple times throughout the class. The four main methods are lineCount, wordCount, averageCharacterCount and mostCommonLetter. The readFile method is called at the start of each of the above four. It resets the buffered reader back to the start of the file.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aatina Punjabi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileStatistic(java.lang.String filePath)
      The constructor takes in the file path relative to the working directory.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float averageCharacterCount()
      AverageCharacterCount returns the average number of characters per word.
      int lineCount()
      LineCount returns the number of lines in a file as an primitive integer type.
      java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> mostCommonLetter()
      MostCommonLetter returns the most recurring letter in the file as a map with letter = #occurrences.
      int wordCount()
      WordCount returns the number of words in a file as an primitive integer type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileStatistic

        public FileStatistic(java.lang.String filePath)
        The constructor takes in the file path relative to the working directory.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • lineCount

        public int lineCount()
        LineCount returns the number of lines in a file as an primitive integer type. Returns -1 if file was not found.
        Returns:
        Number of lines in current file

      • wordCount

        public int wordCount()
        WordCount returns the number of words in a file as an primitive integer type. Returns -1 if file was not found.
        Returns:
        Number of words in current file

      • averageCharacterCount

        public float averageCharacterCount()
        AverageCharacterCount returns the average number of characters per word. Returns -1 if file was not found. LineCount and WordCount are called at the beginning; their values are required for a calculation in this method
        Returns:
        Average number of letters per word in the file

      • mostCommonLetter

        public java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> mostCommonLetter()
        MostCommonLetter returns the most recurring letter in the file as a map with letter = #occurrences. If there are multiple characters with the same value, then it returns the one with the lowest index Returns null if file is not found LineCount is called at the beginning; its value is required for a calculation in this method
        Returns:
        The first found most occurring letter in the file
